result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Slomski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Cash Bail of $100 is applied to forfeiture.  Balance of $167.50 to be paid within 120 days or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment of fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron M Slomski

records.addlTxt:
03:53 PM Defendant Aaron M Slomski in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$267.50,  cash bail be applied, balance to be paid within 120 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 24, 2021 at 04:00 pm.

03:40 PM Court appears by Zoom (video).  Defendant Aaron M Slomski in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared by Zoom (video) for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court will not issue the capias that was stayed from the last hearing.  Parties are working on a resolution that may include an amendment.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2021 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing on February 3, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

12:09 PM Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court.   Defendant Aaron M Slomski did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nimmer believed that her client was going to appear as he did receive the zoom information by text. 
Court stays a capias to the next date.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

10:18 AM Defendant Aaron M Slomski appears by Zoom with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer. who appears by Zoom.  Claudia Ayala appears by Zoom for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nimmer states she was just appointed and does not have discovery nor an offer.
ADA Ayala states that due to the age of the case, the notes on the file do not state an offer was sent nor discovery.
The Court will adjourn.
Zoom appearance is granted.  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2021 at 11:30 am.
